flowContents.comments: Reads data from the source database's CDC stream, and performs incremental replication for enabled tables.

source.comments: Merges all pending changes from the journal table into the destination.
source.name: Merge Journal to Destination

destination.comments: Drops the first DDL FlowFile to prevent it from deleting a freshly-created journal table.
destination.name: Drop First DDL

source.comments: Changes the destination table based on the incoming DDL event.
source.name: Alter Destination Table

destination.comments: Add an extra attribute to the FlowFile with the source table's Fully Qualified Name.
destination.name: Set Source Table FQN

destination.name: Schedule Warehouse

source.comments: Waits until the Snapshot load for a table is complete, and the connector can start merging incremental changes.
source.name: Wait for Snapshot Load to Finish

parameters.description: The database where data will be persisted. It must already exist in Snowflake
parameters.name: Destination Database

parameters.description: Leave this blank when using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy. When using KEY_PAIR, provide your Snowflake account name formatted as [organization-name]-[account-name] where data will be persisted.
parameters.name: Snowflake Account Identifier

parameters.description: When using SPCS, use SNOWFLAKE_SESSION_TOKEN as the value for Authentication Strategy. When using BYOC, use KEY_PAIR as the value for Authentication Strategy.
parameters.name: Snowflake Authentication Strategy

parameters.description: When using KEY_PAIR, specify the strategy for connecting to Snowflake. Possible values: STANDARD, PRIVATE_CONNECTIVITY
parameters.name: Snowflake Connection Strategy

parameters.description:
Do not change after initial start of the connector. Determines if schema/table/column names are treated as case-sensitive or case-insensitive.
One of: CASE_INSENSITIVE / CASE_SENSITIVE
parameters.name: Snowflake Object Identifier Resolution

parameters.description: Leave this blank when using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy. When using KEY_PAIR, provide the RSA private key used for authentication. The RSA key must be formatted according to PKCS8 standards and have standard PEM headers and footers. Note that either Snowflake Private Key File or Snowflake Private Key must be defined.
parameters.name: Snowflake Private Key

parameters.description: Leave this blank when using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy. When using KEY_PAIR, upload the file that contains the RSA Private Key used for authentication to Snowflake, formatted according to PKCS8 standards and having standard PEM headers and footers. The header line begins with -----BEGIN PRIVATE. Select the Reference asset checkbox to upload the private key file.
parameters.name: Snowflake Private Key File

parameters.description: Leave this blank when using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy. When using KEY_PAIR, provide the password associated with the Snowflake Private Key File.
parameters.name: Snowflake Private Key Password

parameters.description: When using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy, use your Runtime Role. You can find your Runtime Role in the Openflow UI, by going to View Details for your Runtime. When using Key Pair for your Authentication Strategy, use a valid role configured for your service user.
parameters.name: Snowflake Role

parameters.description: Leave this blank when using Session Token for your Authentication Strategy. When using KEY_PAIR, provide the user name used to connect to Snowflake instance.
parameters.name: Snowflake Username

parameters.description: Snowflake warehouse used to run queries
parameters.name: Snowflake Warehouse

parameters.description: A JSON specifying which columns and column patterns should be included or excluded from replication, per table. Takes the form of an array with one object per table, e.g. [ {"database": "DB1", "schema":"public", "table":"table1", "includedPattern":".*name"} ] - this will include all columns that end with 'name' in the 'table1' from the 'public' schema in database DB1.
parameters.name: Column Filter JSON

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fully-qualified table names that should be replicated. The format should be <database>.<schema name>.<table name>. If names are case sensitive or contain special characters - they should be quoted. For example: "db1"."public"."table1", DB2.SCHEMA2."table2", "db3"."public"."table3"
parameters.name: Included Table Names

parameters.description: A Regular Expression that can be matched against table names to determine if the table should be included. The Regular Expression should match the fully qualified table name: <database>.<schema>.<table>. For example, to include all tables in the DB1 database and "public" schema, use DB1\.public\..*
parameters.name: Included Table Regex

parameters.description: Determine if snapshot load should be skipped and only incremental CDC phase should take place. If set to "incremental" current database rows will not be replicated (snapshot will be skipped) and only new changes will be applied. Default value is "full" which means both snapshot and incremental will be performed.
parameters.name: Ingestion Type

parameters.description:
CRON expression defining periods when merge operations from Journal to Destination Table will be triggered. Set it to * * * * * ? if you want to have continuous merge or time schedule to limitate warehouse run time.
For example:
 The string * 0 * * * ? indicates that you want to schedule merges at full hour for one minute
 The string * 20 14 ? * MON-FRI indicates that you want to schedule merges at 2:20 PM every Monday through Friday.
For additional information and examples, see the cron triggers tutorial in the Quartz Documentation https://www.quartz-scheduler.org/documentation/quartz-2.2.2/tutorials/tutorial-lesson-06.html
parameters.name: Merge Task Schedule CRON

parameters.description: Only applicable when 'Starting Change Tracking Position' is set to 'Earliest'. Choose whether re-reading events from the earliest position should include tables in any active state (set 'Any active'), or new tables only (set 'New').
parameters.name: Re-read Tables in State

parameters.description: Position from which to start reading the change tracking. 'Latest' is the default, starts from the last available position. 'Earliest' starts from the oldest available position. If a running connector is switched to the 'Earliest' position after it has been running earlier, it will re-read events from the start of the binlog. While this re-reading proceeds, it cannot be cancelled.
parameters.name: Starting Change Tracking Position

parameters.description: The JDBC Connection URL
parameters.name: SQLServer Connection URL

parameters.description: The JDBC Driver JAR File reference. Download the jar from its website, then select the 'Reference asset' checkbox to upload and attach it.
parameters.name: SQLServer JDBC Driver

parameters.description: The password for interacting with SQLServer
parameters.name: SQLServer Password

parameters.description: The username for interacting with SQLServer
parameters.name: SQLServer Username
